intro: Djaloniella ypsilostyla, commonly known as the narrow-stemmed djaloniella, is a rare and endemic plant species found in specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in umbels, a common feature in the Apiaceae family. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
